perturbation.original_text: PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT AGREES that all television shows, DVD Magazines, Internet Streaming Video Television Shows, Television Shorts, Radio Shows, Radio Shorts, Cell Phone Video Clips, Caller ID Video Clips, Promotional Commercials, Websites, Streaming Video Commercials, Streaming Video Highlight Shows, 24 Hour Nostalgia Sports Network, DVD Program Package, Television Show Series, stock footage library, and print promotional posters, created and or produced with any content provided by PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT are wholly owned by THE HENRY FILM AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION.
perturbation.changed_text: PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT AGREES that all television shows, DVD Magazines, Internet Streaming Video Television Shows, Television Shorts, Radio Shows, Radio Shorts, Cell Phone Video Clips, Caller ID Video Clips, Promotional Commercials, Websites, Streaming Video Commercials, Streaming Video Highlight Shows, 24 Hour Nostalgia Sports Network, DVD Program Package, Television Show Series, stock footage library, and print promotional posters, created and or produced with any content provided by PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT may be co-owned by both PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT and THE HENRY FILM AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION, subject to further negotiation and agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that THE HENRY FILM AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION wholly owns the created content. The modified version introduces uncertainty by stating the content 'may be co-owned,' which contradicts the original statement. This creates a conflict regarding the ownership rights of the produced content, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text: After the Initial Term, this Agreement will be automatically renewed for successive additional 3~year periods (“Extension Terms”), unless otherwise terminated by either party by giving notice to the other party not less than sixty (60) days prior to the end of a Term. As used herein, the “Term” means the Initial Term and any Extension Term(s).
perturbation.changed_text: After the Initial Term, this Agreement may or may not be renewed. Renewal terms are subject to mutual agreement between both parties and depend on performance metrics to be determined at the end of the initial term. The criteria for renewal may be waived at the sole discretion of PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT. As used herein, the “Term” means the Initial Term and any Extension Term(s).
perturbation.explanation: The original text establishes automatic renewal unless terminated with 60 days' notice. The modified version introduces uncertainty by stating that renewal is not automatic and depends on mutual agreement and performance metrics. This contradicts the original clause, making it unclear whether the agreement will automatically renew or requires additional steps.

perturbation.original_text: Neither party shall make any public announcement regarding the existence or Content of this Agreement without the other party’s prior written approval and consent.
perturbation.changed_text: Either party can make a public announcement regarding the existence and Content of this agreement without the prior written approval or consent of the other party. However, making a public announcement without consent is discouraged, but not prohibited.
perturbation.explanation: The original text prevents either party from making public announcements without prior written consent. The modified version explicitly allows either party to make public announcements, directly contradicting the original restriction. The phrase 'discouraged, but not prohibited' further solidifies the contradiction and creates ambiguity about the enforceability of the confidentiality of the agreement regarding public announcements.
